metadata.title: CVE-2017-17458 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Mercurial before 4.4.1, it is possible that a specially malformedrepository can cause Git subrepositories to run arbitrary code in the formof a .git/hooks/post-update script checked into the repository. Typical useof Mercurial prevents construction of such repositories, but they can becreated programmatically.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 3.7.3-1ubuntu1.1
mercurial-common - 3.7.3-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.3-1ubuntu1.1').
